sections.title: Overview
sections.content: Network-wide ad blocking via your own Linux hardware The Pi-holeÂ® is a DNS sinkhole that protects your devices from unwanted content, without installing any client-side software. Easy-to-install: our versatile installer walks you through the process, and takes less than ten minutes Robust: a command-line interface that is quality assured for interoperability Insightful: a beautiful responsive Web Interface dashboard to view and control your Pi-hole Free: open-source software which helps ensure you are the sole person in control of your privacy

sections.title: Pi-hole is free, but powered by your support
sections.content: There are many reoccurring costs involved with maintaining free, open-source, and privacy respecting software; expenses which our volunteer developers pitch in to cover out-of-pocket. This is just one example of how strongly we feel about our software, as well as the importance of keeping it maintained. Make no mistake: your support is absolutely vital to help keep us innovating!

sections.title: Donations
sections.content: Sending a donation using our links below is extremely helpful in offsetting a portion of our monthly expenses: Donate via PayPal or Stripe Bitcoin, Bitcoin Cash, Ethereum, Litecoin

sections.title: Alternative support
sections.content: If you'd rather not donate (which is okay!), there are other ways you can help support us:

sections.title: Contributing via GitHub
sections.content: We welcome everyone to contribute to issue reports, suggest new features, and create pull requests. If you have something to add - anything from a typo through to a whole new feature, we're happy to check it out! Just make sure to fill out our template when submitting your request; the questions that it asks will help the volunteers quickly understand what you're aiming to achieve. Last update: June 2, 2020
